recently_narrative: The Zendesk ecosystem has seen a flurry of activity in the past three weeks, with the company doubling down on its AI-powered vision for the future of contact centers. While Zendesk is announcing new features like intelligent triage for voice calls and scaling outcome-based pricing with AI, it has also faced some stability issues, including service incidents and QA access problems. This push towards AI-driven customer service solutions comes as Zendesk prepares to shutter its Zendesk Sell CRM, signaling a strategic shift towards a more focused, customer service-centric approach. For Zendesk professionals, this means navigating a rapidly evolving landscape, where the promise of AI-powered efficiency must be balanced with the need for reliable, resilient systems to support their customers.
